title: Celebrating the opening of the new Roscoe-Rockland firehouse in Roscoe, New York
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  celebrating the opening of the new Roscoe-Rock-
land firehouse in Roscoe, New York

WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to celebrate the opening of  the
new Roscoe-Rockland firehouse in Roscoe, New York, and to honor the past
and  present firefighting members of the Roscoe-Rockland Fire Department
for their years of fire protection to the citizens  of  Roscoe-Rockland,
New York; and
  WHEREAS, After a decade of planning, the new Roscoe-Rockland firehouse
in  Roscoe,  New York, has opened in the old Kirchner's Chevrolet build-
ing; and
  WHEREAS, The new Roscoe-Rockland firehouse is the pride and joy of the
firefighters of the Roscoe-Rockland Fire Department who put their blood,
sweat and tears into the renovation  of  the  old  Kirchner's  Chevrolet
building; and
  WHEREAS,  In addition to the efforts of the Roscoe-Rockland firefight-
ers and their families to launch the new Roscoe-Rockland firehouse,  the
members of the Ladies Auxiliary, fire commissioners, and volunteers from
throughout  the town contributed mightily to successfully completing the
project; and
  WHEREAS, Fire departments are an integral part of community protection
services in every locality of our State;  during  the  past  years,  the
courageous  and devoted firefighters of the Roscoe-Rockland Fire Depart-
ment in Roscoe, New York, have valiantly responded to all types of  fire
emergencies  and  have won the praise and respect of the community which
they serve; and
  WHEREAS, With a membership of dedicated firefighters,  the  record  of
the   Roscoe-Rockland   Fire  Department  in  public  service  and  fire
protection is one to be envied; for 24 hours a day, for 365 days a year,
whenever the alarm sounded, these noble volunteers left their homes  and
went to the aid of their neighbors; and
  WHEREAS, The brave firefighters of the Roscoe-Rockland Fire Department
are  prepared  to  risk  their lives every day to help save the lives of
others and to protect homes and property from the destruction caused  by
fire; and
  WHEREAS,  In addition to the skill and devoted service demonstrated by
individual firefighters, the Roscoe-Rockland  Fire  Department  reflects
the history and development of firefighting over the years; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body cannot express sufficient gratitude to
those devoted individuals who recognize that the  preservation  of  life
and property is a sacred responsibility and who make that responsibility
their own by serving as firefighters; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that we should give
special recognition to those who work so assiduously for the  betterment
of  their  communities,  and  acknowledge publicly the heroic good works
performed by the volunteer fire departments of this great Empire  State,
their officers and auxiliaries; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
proudly celebrate the opening of the new  Roscoe-Rockland  firehouse  in
Roscoe, New York, and to honor the past and present firefighting members
of   the  Roscoe-Rockland  Fire  Department  for  their  years  of  fire
protection to the citizens of  Roscoe-Rockland,  New  York;  and  be  it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Keith Travers, Chief, Roscoe-Rockland Fire Department, P.O.
Box 174, Roscoe, New York 12776.
